text: [Music]
hi my name is Trevor Dyke I'm here to
introduce Amazon MQ Amazon MQ is a
managed message broker service for
Apache ActiveMQ that makes it easy to
set up and operate message brokers in
the cloud message brokers a lot of
different software systems often using
different programming languages and on
different platforms to communicate and
exchange information messaging is the
communications backbone that connects
and integrates the components of almost
all distributed applications for example
when you place an order on Amazon com
the web app uses messaging to send
instructions to the order processing and
fulfillment systems with Amazon MQ your
applications can use industry standard
api's and protocols for messaging
including JMS AMQP stomp MQTT and
WebSocket you can easily move your apps
from any message broker that uses these
standards to Amazon mq because you don't
have to rewrite any messaging code in
your applications this is especially
valuable for enterprises that are
migrating to the cloud using Amazon mq
you can also bridge between your own
data center and the cloud enabling
hybrid architectures Amazon MQ supports
all the key features required to migrate
from your existing message broker to a
managed service queues and topics both
transient and persistent messaging local
and distributed transactions and more
with Amazon mq the underlying
infrastructure is automatically
provisioned for high availability and a
message durability to support the
reliability of your applications because
it's a managed service Amazon MQ
automates the time-consuming tasks of
operating message brokers and reduces
operational overhead including
provisioning patching and updates
security maintenance monitoring and
troubleshooting Amazon and queue is
secure it provides encryption both in
transit and at rest works within your
AWS VPC and provides security groups
that act as a virtual firewall to guard
against unwanted access amazon mq is
integrated with your Amazon Cloud watch
so you can monitor the health of your
message broker and your applications you
can set alarms to notify you when
something goes wrong
you can also use auto-scaling to scale
up your applications when there are more
messages to process Amazon mq increases
your efficiency because you no longer
have to manage your own messaging
infrastructure log into the Amazon and
queue console today and see how easy it
is to launch your first message broker
thanks for watching
[Music]
